com.gl.vn.me.ko.sample.instrumentation.util.javassist

Class JavassistEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gl.vn.me.ko.sample.instrumentation.util.javassist.JavassistEnvironment

  • public final class JavassistEnvironment
extends Object
    Provides API to work with Javassist framework. It also facilitates the creation/recreation of an underlying ClassPool object.

    Note that it doesn't support hierarchy of class loaders. It means that the class is not applicable for cases when classes with the same name are loaded with different class loaders (don't be disoriented by the method getCtClass(ClassLoader, String)).

    The class provides an ability to obtain an exclusive access to its methods, see lock() and unlock() methods.

    Note also that CtClass is not thread-safe, so all operations with the class must be explicitly synchronized in case of concurrent access. Unfortunately it's impossible to hide the underlying ClassPool object behind the JavassistEnvironment class, because CtClass.getClassPool() method allows everyone to access the ClassPool object, and therefore even if one uses lock() for exclusive access to JavassistEnvironment there is no guarantee that no one else use the same CtClass object.

    Instantiability: forbidden.
    Thread safety: thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • appendClassPath

        public static final boolean appendClassPath(ClassPath classPath)
        Appends a ClassPath object to the end of the search path of the underlying ClassPool object.
        Parameters:
        classPath - The class path to append. Must be not null.
        Returns:
        • true if specified class path was appended.
        • false if specified class path wasn't appended because it was appended previously.

      • getCtBytes

        public static final byte[] getCtBytes(CtClass ctClass)
                               throws CannotCompileException
        Converts provided class object to a class file. Once this method is called, the class object becomes frozen and further modifications are not possible till the defrost procedure.
        Parameters:
        ctClass - Class object to convert. Must be not null.
        Returns:
        The contents of the class file.
        Throws:
        CannotCompileException - When bytecode transformation has failed.
        See Also:
        CtClass.isFrozen(), CtClass.defrost()

      • getCtClass

        public static final CtClass getCtClass(Class<?> clazz)
                                throws NotFoundException
        Acts just like getCtClass(ClassLoader, String) considering that supplied instance of Class have information about defining class loader and class name.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class to search. Must be not null.
        Returns:
        A CtClass object representing specified class.
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - When the requested class can't be find in the underlying ClassPool object.
        See Also:
        getCtClass(ClassLoader, String)

      • getCtClass

        public static final CtClass getCtClass(@Nullable
                                       ClassLoader classLoader,
                                       String className)
                                throws NotFoundException
        Reads a class file from the source and returns a reference to the CtClass object representing that class file. This method is equivalent to getCtClass(String) except that it tries to get CtClass object using known class path (see getCtClassOrNull(String)) and in case of failure it appends class path obtained from the provided class loader and tries to get the class once again (see getCtClass(String)). In other words the method does something like
         {
        CtClass result;
        if (classLoader == null) {// bootstrap class loader
                result = JavassistEnvironment.getCtClass(className);
        } else {
                // try to get CtClass using known class path
                result = JavassistEnvironment.getCtClassOrNull(className);
                if (result == null) {// class wasn't found in the known class path
                        JavassistEnvironment.appendClassPath(new LoaderClassPath(classLoader));
                        result = JavassistEnvironment.getCtClassUnsync(className);
                }
        }
        return result;
 }
        Parameters:
        classLoader - The defining loader of the class (should be null if the bootstrap loader).
        className - A fully-qualified class name. Must be not null.
        Returns:
        A CtClass object representing specified class.
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - When the requested class can't be find in the underlying ClassPool object.
        See Also:
        getCtClass(String)

      • getCtClass

        public static final CtClass getCtClass(String className)
                                throws NotFoundException
        Reads a class file from the source and returns a reference to the CtClass object representing that class file. If that class file has been already read from the same ClassPool object, this method returns a reference to the CtClass created when that class file was read at the first time.

        If class name ends with "[]", then this method returns a CtClass object for that array type. To obtain an nested class, use "$" instead of "." for separating the enclosing class name and the nested class name.

        Returned object always have pruning turned off.

        Parameters:
        className - A fully qualified class name (for example "java.lang.Object" or "java/lang/Object"). Must be not null.
        Returns:
        A CtClass object representing specified class.
        Throws:
        NotFoundException - When the requested class can't be find in the underlying ClassPool object.

      • getCtClassOrNull

        @Nullable
public static final CtClass getCtClassOrNull(String className)
        Reads a class file from the source and returns a reference to the CtClass object representing that class file. This method is equivalent to getCtClass(String) except that it returns null when a class file is not found and it never throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        className - A fully-qualified class name. Must be not null.
        Returns:
        A CtClass object representing specified class or null.
        See Also:
        getCtClass(String)

      • lock

        public static final void lock()
        Provides an ability to control access to JavassistEnvironment class methods. If a thread tries to invoke a method (except unlock()) of JavassistEnvironment class (even without trying to acquire the lock) and the lock is held by another thread, then current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until lock has been released.

        Acquires the lock if the lock aren't held by another thread and returns immediately. The lock is reentrant so if the current thread already holds the lock then the hold count is incremented by one and the method returns immediately.

        If one need to obtain exclusive access to JavassistEnvironment, one can lock the environment, do required actions and unlock the environment. The following idiom should be used 

         JavassistEnvironment.lock();
 try {
        // exclusive work with JavassistEnvironment
 } finally {
        JavassistEnvironment.unlock();
 }
        See Also:
        unlock()

      • prependClassPath

        public static final boolean prependClassPath(ClassPath classPath)
        Prepends a ClassPath object to the head of the search path of the underlying ClassPool object.
        Parameters:
        classPath - The class path to append. Must be not null.
        Returns:
        • true if specified class path was prepended.
        • false if specified class path wasn't prepended because it was prepended previously.

      • renew

        public static final void renew(boolean preserveClassPath)
        Recreates the underlying instance of ClassPool that is used by JavassistEnvironment.
        Parameters:
        preserveClassPath - Specifies if class path elements prepended/appended via methods prependClassPath(ClassPath), appendClassPath(ClassPath) must be presented in a new instance of ClassPool.

      • unlock

        public static final void unlock()
        Provides an ability to control access to JavassistEnvironment class methods. Attempts to release the lock. If the current thread is the holder of the lock then the hold count is decremented. If the hold count is now zero then the lock is released. If the current thread is not the holder of this lock then IllegalMonitorStateException is thrown.
        See Also:
        lock()
